page.title: 12BUILDINGS IN DRAYCOTT
page.content: {HOUSING}IN {DRAYCOTT}HAS ALMOST DOUBLED SINCE 1940 AND IS STILL GROWING. COUNCIL OWNED SHELTERED ACCOMMODATION FOR THE ELDERLY INCLUDES A COMMON ROOM USED WEEKLY FOR A DAY CENTRE FOR THE AREA'S DISABLED. DRAYCOTT ALSO HAS A PRIVATELY OWNED RESIDENTIAL HOME. THE FORMER {RAILWAY {STATION} AND {METHODIST SCHOOLROOM} HAVE BEEN CONVERTED INTO DWELLINGS AS THE METHODIST CHURCH BUILT IN 1876 IS TO BE. THE {MEMORIAL HALL} WAS CONVERTED FROM A {WESLEYAN CHAPEL} AFTER 1918 AS A WAR MEMORIAL. TRUSTEES AND A COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF REPRESENTATIVES OF ALL GROUPS ADMINISTER IT. THE PLAYGROUP MEET THERE THREE TIMES A WEEK, THE W.I. MONTHLY AND OTHER FORMS OF ENTERTAINMENT AND FUND RAISING BY VILLAGE ORGANISATIONS FREQUENTLY.
